entities: United Nations Country Team in Somalia
summary:
The Security Council:

Reaffirms previous resolutions and statements on Somalia, stressing full compliance and implementation.
Reaffirms respect for Somalia's sovereignty, territorial integrity, political independence, and unity.

Emphasizes UNSOM's essential role in supporting Somalia's Federal Government and Member States through strategic advice, capacity-building, and coordination of international partners' support.

Decides to:
1. Extend UNSOM's mandate until 31 August 2020 as set out in resolution 2158 (2014) and requests implementation in accordance with resolution 2461 (2019).
2. Request the Secretary-General to provide regular updates and written reports every 90 days on the situation and progress towards key political benchmarks, with the next report due by 13 August 2020.
3. Remain seized of this matter.
